TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AddressHeaderCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader>

Docs.summary: Represents a thread-safe, read-only collection of address headers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection> can be initialized with an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> set of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader> objects and then searched for a header with a specific qualified name using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindHeader%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method. To find all of the headers with a specific qualified name, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindAll%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.AddHeadersTo%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%29> method is used to add headers to the headers of a specified message.

Docs.param: The set of objects used to initialize the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from an enumerable set of address headers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddHeadersTo(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message message) cil managed

Docs.param: The to which the headers are added.
Docs.summary: Adds the headers in the collection to the headers of a specified message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This inserts the headers from the current collection into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders> associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> and accessible through the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Headers%2A> property.
## Examples The following code snippet illustrates how to call this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader[] FindAll(string name, string ns) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the address header to be found.
The namespace of the address header to be found.
Docs.summary: Finds all the address headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace.
Docs.returns: The of type that contains all the headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace.

remarks.format: ## Examples The following code snippet illustrates how to call this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader FindHeader(string name, string ns) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the address header to be found.
The namespace of the address header to be found.
Docs.summary: Finds the first address header in the collection with a specified name and namespace.
Docs.returns: The in the collection with the specified name and namespace.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you need to find all the address headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindAll%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method instead.
<xref:System.ArgumentException> is not the ideal exception type when there is more than one header in the collection. Callers of this method should take care to handle this exception when the collection contains multiple entries with the same name and namespace.
